page.title: 17Religion in Alstonefield
page.content: There are Quakers living in Alstonefield. Nuns come and stay with a woman about once a month. The house they stay in is called The Hollow. Because the house is built down in a hollow, it has been named after it. There are a lot of Christians in Alstonefield. The vicar, Rev. Tinsley told us that there are about 250 people living in Alstonefield. There is a church service every Sunday with about 16 to 20 regular attenders, but about 100 people attend on special occasions. In 1984 the church roof was repaired and when the builder came to put up the scaffolding they had to pull up some boards and they found two whole skeletons. The places called Pea Low, Steep Low and Low Plantation are burial mounds. There was an excavation at Pea Low many years ago.
